edea8259-61ae-4444-97d2-c2e3925732af.description: Earners of the Flexible Learning Design badge have demonstrated capability in developing a unit following a Flexible Learning Design approach.
edea8259-61ae-4444-97d2-c2e3925732af.name: Flexible Learning Design

badge_template_activities.title: Has successfully met the requirements and completed the Flexible Learning Design program at Navitas.

ce9a9e9c-9329-4f3a-a95b-7eca97c880da.description: Recipients of the ACAP MBA Leadership credential have a comprehensive and in-depth understanding of leadership. Participants are able to identify their personal leadership style, have explored current and foundational leadership theory, as well as change leadership in organisations.
ce9a9e9c-9329-4f3a-a95b-7eca97c880da.name: Leadership

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 8
alignments.description: AQF is the Australian Quality Framework. Level 8 refers to post graduate Certificate or Diploma level of study, and students at this level apply knowledge and skills to demonstrate autonomy, well-developed judgement, adaptability and responsibility as a practitioner or learner.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants have engaged in intensive learning sessions, joined in weekly learning activities, and engaged in robust discussions with peers and facilitators, as well as completed the following assessment tasks to demonstrate their understanding of leadership.

Participants have completed a leadership style reflection that integrated learning about the qualities of a personal leadership style with the various leadership theories examined to formulate a leadership statement that is reflective of their current leadership stance.

Participants have developed an adaptive leadership plan by identifying, analysing, and creating a plan for addressing an adaptive challenge in the organisation they work in, utilising key course concepts and reflecting on the leadership implications in leading the change effort.

Participants have responded to an ethical leadership case study and made decisions related to the future business directions and provided the rationale for their decisions utilising leadership theories and practices.

d999de1b-4ee1-4967-b1d0-a8de88af7d16.description: Recipients of the NavitasACAP MBA Project Management credential are able to successfully manage projects in line with the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBoK), including initiating, planning, executing, controlling and closing the work of a team to achieve specified goals and success criteria for a defined project.
d999de1b-4ee1-4967-b1d0-a8de88af7d16.name: Project Management

alignments.name: Project Management Body of Knowledge
alignments.description: The Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBoK) is a collection of processes, best practices, terminologies, and guidelines that are accepted as standard within the project management industry.

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 8
alignments.description: AQF is the Australian Quality Framework. Level 8 refers to post graduate Certificate or Diploma level of study, and students at this level apply knowledge and skills to demonstrate autonomy, well-developed judgement, adaptability and responsibility as a practitioner or learner.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants have engaged in intensive learning sessions, joined in weekly learning activities, and engaged in robust discussions with peers and facilitators, as well as completed the following assessment tasks to demonstrate their understanding of project management.

Participants have provided a critical analysis of a failed project and presented the findings in a written business report. The report included an executive summary, theoretical analysis and recommendations to improve the outcomes of the failed project.
Participants have completed a critical review of a previously completed project based on the skills and knowledge developed during this unit of study.
Participants have created a project charter - based on the principles of the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBoK).

e22c1f8a-f446-44db-99b6-0d5cbe57c831.description: Recipients of the ACAP MBA People Management credential have a comprehensive understanding of how to manage people and engage in human resource management practices in the workplace. Participants understand the principles of how to develop staff and create a culture that leads to high levels of employee satisfaction, engagement, and communication, in support of overall business goals.
e22c1f8a-f446-44db-99b6-0d5cbe57c831.name: People Management

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 8
alignments.description: AQF is the Australian Quality Framework. Level 8 refers to post graduate Certificate or Diploma level of study, and students at this level apply knowledge and skills to demonstrate autonomy, well-developed judgement, adaptability and responsibility as a practitioner or learner.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants have engaged in intensive learning sessions, joined in weekly learning activities, and engaged in robust discussions with peers and facilitators, as well as completed the following assessment tasks to demonstrate their understanding of people management.

Participants have completed an essay that focused on the planning, performance and reflection on the experience of conducting a difficult conversation, while considering the 8 key elements of difficult conversations to inform their thinking.

Participants have completed a HR Improvement Report in response to a case study, by reviewing the overall HR programs and policies and identified areas for improvement. The report included integrating HR programs and policies related to the business of managing people.

Participants have completed a people management case study by considering the primary issues from an HR perspective, as well as costs to the company, benefits of the situation and possible solutions or interventions.

5b3deacd-c0ce-48a5-ae3a-98b5344827bd.description: Earners of the Designing Active Learning module badge have demonstrated capability to describe the characteristics and benefits of active learning strategies in relation to underpinning principles, appraise a learning activity that attempts to employ active learning and develop an appropriate learning activity that employs active learning principles based on an identified learning and teaching challenge/opportunity.
5b3deacd-c0ce-48a5-ae3a-98b5344827bd.name: Designing Active Learning

badge_template_activities.title: Has successfully completed the assessment task and all requirements for the Designing Active Learning module within the Teaching Excellence at Navitas program.

ab6e83da-1442-42aa-af87-6d8d60541c2e.description: Recipients of the ACAP MBA Leadership credential have a comprehensive and in-depth understanding the concepts, tools and techniques that financial managers use in the contemporary business context.
ab6e83da-1442-42aa-af87-6d8d60541c2e.name: Financial Management

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 8
alignments.description: AQF is the Australian Quality Framework. Level 8 refers to post graduate Certificate or Diploma level of study, and students at this level apply knowledge and skills to demonstrate autonomy, well-developed judgement, adaptability and responsibility as a practitioner or learner.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants have engaged in intensive learning sessions, participated in weekly learning activities, and engaged in robust discussions with peers and facilitators, as well as completed the following assessment tasks to demonstrate their understanding of Financial Management.

Participants have completed a report that identifies static, flexible and continuous budgets and variances, reporting on performance, break even analysis and explanation for observed variances. Investigated cost volume profit analysis comparing actual with budgeted performance.

Participants have prepared a report evaluating capital investment projects and to recommended a course of action considering the net present value (NPV) method and the internal rate of return (IRR) methods of capital investment appraisal.

Participants have performed a financial statement analysis based on the statements of financial position, financial performance and cash flows over the two most recent financial years of an ASX listed company, incorporating a ratio analysis and horizontal/comparative analysis. Key ratios used in the analysis included liquidity, efficiency, profitability and solvency ratios.

81483e8a-2ee8-4c0b-8b27-35bac202159c.description: Earners of this badge have participated in an extensive learning analytics program and built knowledge and capability in learning analytics and student retention. The program helped develop a better understanding of learning analytics and the ways in which analytics is interpreted, applied, and actioned by teachers to improve teaching and learning practices.
81483e8a-2ee8-4c0b-8b27-35bac202159c.name: Learning Analytics Program

badge_template_activities.title: Has successfully met the requirements and completed the Learning Analytics Program ("Let's Talk Learning Analytics") at Navitas.

12785881-2abd-4802-a43b-7e7f529a471e.description: Earners of the Designing Rubrics module badge have demonstrated capability in employing a range of strategies to ensure objective, consistent and accurate judgements about assessment, including the use of rubrics. Earners can create a rubric to address specific learning outcomes in their teaching context.
12785881-2abd-4802-a43b-7e7f529a471e.name: Designing Rubrics

badge_template_activities.title: Has successfully completed the assessment task and all requirements for the Designing Rubrics module within the Teaching Excellence at Navitas program.

a6f16dd0-2115-4724-992d-dcf2e54afbb9.description: Earners of Designing Blended Learning module badge have demonstrated capability to define blended learning and explore the range of option for implementing learning using established principles and frameworks from the scholarship of teaching and learning, to identify a learning an teaching issue in their current practice and design a blended learning solution.
a6f16dd0-2115-4724-992d-dcf2e54afbb9.name: Designing Blended Learning

4842760c-a4d2-40be-a76f-9cf9438b5582.description: Earners of the Developing a Professional Teacher Identity module badge have demonstrated an ability to assess their individual compliance with relevant organisational policies, standards, and legislation associated with being a teacher in the Navitas context. aa7cc67d-a117-4953-b340-cd8842ece986.description: Earners of the Teaching in the Navitas Context module badge have demonstrated capability in facilitating a relevant, engaging and challenging curriculum to support a student-centred learning environment for diverse learning groups. 7464f8dd-479f-44de-bd0d-66ee8525c52e.description: Earners of the Designing Lesson Plans module badge have demonstrated capability in planning a lesson that is constructively aligned to a unit's learning outcomes using appropriate disciplinary knowledge and pedagogical approaches. cf5b4e65-bfc0-43e9-894f-79e93e4bbceb.description: Earners of the Moderating and Validating Assessments module badge have demonstrated capability in facilitating student learning through judicious selection and use of assessment moderation and validation practices. 38e092de-ad20-4a7f-b6e3-5ef526cfe257.name: Learning and Teaching Facilitator

91b2dc04-c3e1-4936-abd7-f353d4fd37b8.name: Creating Accessible Learning Opportunities

alignments.name: Teaching Excellence at Navitas Capability Framework
alignments.description: The TEN Capability Framework guides and supports teaching and academic support staff in the delivery of high-quality student learning experiences. This framework also offers a means to discuss, benchmark and provide evidence for performance, progress, and impact as appropriate across the diversity of learning and teaching contexts at Navitas.

alignments.name: TEQSA’s Higher Education Standards Framework (Threshold Standards) 2021
alignments.description: The Higher Education Standards Framework Threshold Standards sets the standards that a provider must meet and continue to meet to be registered to operate as a higher education provider in Australia. The Threshold Standards underpin and provide assurance of quality and integrity in the delivery of Australian higher education.

alignments.name: Advance HE Professional Standards Framework (PSF)
alignments.description: The Professional Standards Framework (PSF) is a globally recognised framework for benchmarking success within higher education teaching and learning.

badge_template_activities.title: Has successfully met the requirements and completed the Creating Accessible Learning Opportunities TEN Flexible Learning module at Navitas.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants have engaged in intensive learning sessions, participated in weekly learning activities, and engaged in robust discussions with peers and facilitators, as well as completed the following assessment tasks to demonstrate their understanding of Financial Decision Making.

Participants have completed a report that identifies static, flexible and continuous budgets and variances, reporting on performance, break even analysis and explanation for observed variances. Investigated cost volume profit analysis comparing actual with budgeted performance.

Participants have prepared a report evaluating capital investment projects and to recommended a course of action considering the net present value (NPV) method and the internal rate of return (IRR) methods of capital investment appraisal.

Key ratios used in the analysis included liquidity, efficiency, profitability and solvency ratios.

1faadcfb-5805-4a3a-b647-daca1a174f8b.description: Earners of the ACAP MBA Leading Strategic Innovation credential have a comprehensive and in-depth understanding of theory, critical analysis tools and practical skills to develop a full business plan focused on strategic invocation for a new venture, including design thinking, risk and competitive analysis, and capital raising.
1faadcfb-5805-4a3a-b647-daca1a174f8b.name: BUS4008 Leading Strategic Innovation

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 9
alignments.description: AQF is the Australian Quality Framework. Level 9 refers to post graduate certificate by coursework or research level of study, and students at this level have specialised knowledge and skills to demonstrate autonomy, expert judgment, adaptability and responsibility as a practitioner or learner.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have engaged in intensive learning sessions, participated in weekly learning activities, and engaged in robust discussions with peers and facilitators, as well as completed the following assessment tasks to demonstrate their understanding of Leading Strategic Innovation.

Prepared a business report on a selected business start-up, showcasing understanding of the business, its market and potential opportunity it presents, supported by critical analysis of design thinking behind the business, the entrepreneur/s, and the organisational culture and risks taken.

Completed a business plan of a viable new venture idea that included design thinking scenarios with evidence to support the venture’s competitive positioning, customer need and outlined clear direction for venture’s success via financial modelling.

Presented a group pitch to potential investors in a compelling manner, including financial and competitive analysis to provide evidence for the sustainability of the business, underpinned by practical application of the key concepts, principles and theory to support the new venture.

1a26a8ca-a673-4517-a540-f11241a003f9.description: Recipients of the ACAP MBA Leadership and Professional Development credential have a comprehensive and in-depth understanding of leadership. Participants are able to identify their personal leadership style, have explored current and foundational leadership theory, as well as change leadership in organisations.
1a26a8ca-a673-4517-a540-f11241a003f9.name: BUS4011 Leadership and Professional Development

alignments.description: AQF is the Australian Quality Framework. Level 8 refers to post graduate Certificate or Diploma level of study, and students at this level apply knowledge and skills to demonstrate autonomy, well-developed judgement, adaptability and responsibility as a practitioner or learner.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants have engaged in intensive learning sessions, joined in weekly learning activities, and engaged in robust discussions with peers and facilitators, as well as completed the following assessment tasks to demonstrate their understanding of leadership and professional development.

Participants have completed a leadership style reflection that integrated learning about the qualities of a personal leadership style with the various leadership theories examined to formulate a leadership statement that is reflective of their current leadership stance.

Participants have developed an adaptive leadership plan by identifying, analysing, and creating a plan for addressing an adaptive challenge in the organisation they work in, utilising key course concepts and reflecting on the leadership implications in leading the change effort.

Participants have responded to an ethical leadership case study and made decisions related to the future business directions and provided the rationale for their decisions utilising leadership theories and practices.

ed600dfb-ca49-4270-9a4e-79b605f70130.description: Recipients of the ACAP MBA Financial Decision Making credential have a comprehensive and in-depth understanding the concepts, tools and techniques that financial managers use in the contemporary business context.
ed600dfb-ca49-4270-9a4e-79b605f70130.name: ACT4011 Financial Decision Making

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 8
alignments.description: AQF is the Australian Quality Framework. Level 8 refers to post graduate Certificate or Diploma level of study, and students at this level apply knowledge and skills to demonstrate autonomy, well-developed judgement, adaptability and responsibility as a practitioner or learner.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants have engaged in intensive learning sessions, participated in weekly learning activities, and engaged in robust discussions with peers and facilitators, as well as completed the following assessment tasks to demonstrate their understanding of Financial Decision Making.

Participants have completed a report that identifies static, flexible and continuous budgets and variances, reporting on performance, break even analysis and explanation for observed variances. Investigated cost volume profit analysis comparing actual with budgeted performance.

Participants have prepared a report evaluating capital investment projects and to recommended a course of action considering the net present value (NPV) method and the internal rate of return (IRR) methods of capital investment appraisal.

Participants have performed a financial statement analysis based on the statements of financial position, financial performance and cash flows over the two most recent financial years of an ASX listed company, incorporating a ratio analysis and horizontal/comparative analysis. Key ratios used in the analysis included liquidity, efficiency, profitability and solvency ratios.

c0997ea8-6a68-499b-8147-bba08f7865e9.description: Recipients of the ACAP MBA Leadership credential have a comprehensive and in-depth understanding of leadership. Participants are able to identify their personal leadership style, have explored current and foundational leadership theory, as well as change leadership in organisations.
c0997ea8-6a68-499b-8147-bba08f7865e9.name: BUS4011 Leadership

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 8
alignments.description: AQF is the Australian Quality Framework. Level 8 refers to post graduate Certificate or Diploma level of study, and students at this level apply knowledge and skills to demonstrate autonomy, well-developed judgement, adaptability and responsibility as a practitioner or learner.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants have engaged in intensive learning sessions, joined in weekly learning activities, and engaged in robust discussions with peers and facilitators, as well as completed the following assessment tasks to demonstrate their understanding of leadership.

Participants have completed a leadership style reflection that integrated learning about the qualities of a personal leadership style with the various leadership theories examined to formulate a leadership statement that is reflective of their current leadership stance.

Participants have developed an adaptive leadership plan by identifying, analysing, and creating a plan for addressing an adaptive challenge in the organisation they work in, utilising key course concepts and reflecting on the leadership implications in leading the change effort.

Participants have responded to an ethical leadership case study and made decisions related to the future business directions and provided the rationale for their decisions utilising leadership theories and practices.

273430db-f384-4dd8-87fa-8b685c8822ee.description: Recipients of the NavitasACAP MBA Project Management credential are able to successfully manage projects in line with the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBoK), including initiating, planning, executing, controlling and closing the work of a team to achieve specified goals and success criteria for a defined project.
273430db-f384-4dd8-87fa-8b685c8822ee.name: BUS4012 Project Management

alignments.name: Project Management Body of Knowledge
alignments.description: The Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBoK) is a collection of processes, best practices, terminologies, and guidelines that are accepted as standard within the project management industry.

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 8
alignments.description: AQF is the Australian Quality Framework. Level 8 refers to post graduate Certificate or Diploma level of study, and students at this level apply knowledge and skills to demonstrate autonomy, well-developed judgement, adaptability and responsibility as a practitioner or learner.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants have engaged in intensive learning sessions, joined in weekly learning activities, and engaged in robust discussions with peers and facilitators, as well as completed the following assessment tasks to demonstrate their understanding of project management.

Participants have provided a critical analysis of a failed project and presented the findings in a written business report. The report included an executive summary, theoretical analysis and recommendations to improve the outcomes of the failed project.
Participants have completed a critical review of a previously completed project based on the skills and knowledge developed during this unit of study.
Participants have created a project charter - based on the principles of the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBoK).

4eaca3a0-0466-4c81-97a6-b406be86f7c9.description: Recipients of the ACAP MBA Project Management credential are able to successfully manage projects in line with the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBoK), including initiating, planning, executing, controlling and closing the work of a team to achieve specified goals and success criteria for a defined project.
4eaca3a0-0466-4c81-97a6-b406be86f7c9.name: BUS4012 Project Management

alignments.name: Project Management Body of Knowledge
alignments.description: The Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBoK) is a collection of processes, best practices, terminologies, and guidelines that are accepted as standard within the project management industry.

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 8
alignments.description: AQF is the Australian Quality Framework. Level 8 refers to post graduate Certificate or Diploma level of study, and students at this level apply knowledge and skills to demonstrate autonomy, well-developed judgement, adaptability and responsibility as a practitioner or learner.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants have engaged in intensive learning sessions, joined in weekly learning activities, and engaged in robust discussions with peers and facilitators, as well as completed the following assessment tasks to demonstrate their understanding of project management.

Participants have provided a critical analysis of a failed project and presented the findings in a written business report. The report included an executive summary, theoretical analysis and recommendations to improve the outcomes of the failed project.
Participants have completed a critical review of a previously completed project based on the skills and knowledge developed during this unit of study.
Participants have created a project charter - based on the principles of the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBoK).

04100f81-e962-4f98-a13a-10e84d809c4e.description: Recipients of the ACAP MBA Leading People and Change credential have a comprehensive understanding of how to manage people and engage in human resource management practices in the workplace. Participants understand the principles of how to develop staff and create a culture that leads to high levels of employee satisfaction, engagement, and communication, in support of overall business goals.
04100f81-e962-4f98-a13a-10e84d809c4e.name: BUS4013 Leading People and Change

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 8
alignments.description: AQF is the Australian Quality Framework. Level 8 refers to post graduate Certificate or Diploma level of study, and students at this level apply knowledge and skills to demonstrate autonomy, well-developed judgement, adaptability and responsibility as a practitioner or learner.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants have engaged in intensive learning sessions, joined in weekly learning activities, and engaged in robust discussions with peers and facilitators, as well as completed the following assessment tasks to demonstrate their understanding of leading people and change.

Participants have completed an essay that focused on the planning, performance and reflection on the experience of conducting a difficult conversation, while considering the 8 key elements of difficult conversations to inform their thinking.

Participants have completed a HR Improvement Report in response to a case study, by reviewing the overall HR programs and policies and identified areas for improvement. The report included integrating HR programs and policies related to the business of managing people.

Participants have completed a people management case study by considering the primary issues from an HR perspective, as well as costs to the company, benefits of the situation and possible solutions or interventions.

7facd939-55d9-44dc-8c52-0e431215aee8.description: Earners of the ACAP MBA Corporate Governance credential have a comprehensive understanding of key principles and theories in corporate governance in the context of practical models. Earners can critically analyse a policy suite for an organisation and outline a plan for monitoring and managing macroeconomic economic activity.
7facd939-55d9-44dc-8c52-0e431215aee8.name: BUS5007 Corporate Governance

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 9
alignments.description: AQF is the Australian Quality Framework. Level 9 refers to post graduate certificate by coursework or research level of study, and students at this level have specialised knowledge and skills to demonstrate autonomy, expert judgment, adaptability and responsibility as a practitioner or learner.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have engaged in intensive learning sessions, participated in weekly learning activities, and engaged in robust discussions with peers and facilitators, as well as completed the following assessment tasks to demonstrate their understanding of Corporate Governance.

Prepared a consultative report responding to Government Tenders for roads, bridges, and freeway construction as part of their expansion strategy by outlining range of corporate governance principles and policies available for consideration. This is supported by explaining structure, and composition of the board of directors.

Completed a consultative report of the corporate governance systems outlining list of policies and an implementation process that articulates the separation between management and governance, along with delivering a presentation to the Board of Directors advising on the practical elements of corporate governance for ASX listed companies, how these are executed, and the value they bring to their assigned engineering contracting firm.

Developed a business report by applying corporate governance policy on contemporary governance, social, or ethical issue and developed a position on their selected issue using quality external sources and theories to build a set of recommendations.

ef60136c-12cf-4309-b6c2-32a24802229e.description: Earners of the ACAP MBA Leading Strategic Innovation credential have a comprehensive and in-depth understanding of theory, critical analysis tools and practical skills to develop a full business plan focused on strategic invocation for a new venture, including design thinking, risk and competitive analysis, and capital raising.
ef60136c-12cf-4309-b6c2-32a24802229e.name: BUS5008 Leading Strategic Innovation

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 9
alignments.description: AQF is the Australian Quality Framework. Level 9 refers to post graduate certificate by coursework or research level of study, and students at this level have specialised knowledge and skills to demonstrate autonomy, expert judgment, adaptability and responsibility as a practitioner or learner.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have engaged in intensive learning sessions, participated in weekly learning activities, and engaged in robust discussions with peers and facilitators, as well as completed the following assessment tasks to demonstrate their understanding of Leading Strategic Innovation.

Prepared a business report on a selected business start-up, showcasing understanding of the business, its market and potential opportunity it presents, supported by critical analysis of design thinking behind the business, the entrepreneur/s, and the organisational culture and risks taken.

Completed a business plan of a viable new venture idea that included design thinking scenarios with evidence to support the venture’s competitive positioning, customer need and outlined clear direction for venture’s success via financial modelling.

Presented a group pitch to potential investors in a compelling manner, including financial and competitive analysis to provide evidence for the sustainability of the business, underpinned by practical application of the key concepts, principles and theory to support the new venture.

5a62c9a9-bc36-4c14-978d-dc77705b0ecb.description: Earners of this badge have examined diversity, equity, and inclusivity principles and frameworks, and considered their application in the classroom. They have developed knowledge and skills required to foster an inclusive classroom environment and curriculum, and developed tailored strategies for use in their classroom context.
5a62c9a9-bc36-4c14-978d-dc77705b0ecb.name: Designing for Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

alignments.name: Teaching Excellence at Navitas Capability Framework
alignments.description: The TEN Capability Framework guides and supports teaching and academic support staff in the delivery of high-quality student learning experiences. This framework also offers a means to discuss, benchmark and provide evidence for performance, progress, and impact as appropriate across the diversity of learning and teaching contexts at Navitas.

alignments.name: TEQSA’s Higher Education Standards Framework (Threshold Standards) 2021
alignments.description: The Higher Education Standards Framework Threshold Standards sets the standards that a provider must meet and continue to meet to be registered to operate as a higher education provider in Australia. The Threshold Standards underpin and provide assurance of quality and integrity in the delivery of Australian higher education.

alignments.name: Advance HE Professional Standards Framework (PSF)
alignments.description: The Professional Standards Framework (PSF) is a globally recognised framework for benchmarking success within higher education teaching and learning.

badge_template_activities.title: Has successfully met the requirements and completed the Designing Inclusive and Equitable Learning Experiences for Diverse Learners module at Navitas.

f8ab37b6-f990-42e6-a2dc-50421d1e79e9.description: Earners of the Introduction to Learning Analytics badge have defined the function and purpose of learning analytics and explored the processes, theory and ethical and privacy considerations required to gather, interpret, and act upon learning analytics data. They have applied foundational learning analytic principles to identify, diagnose and report on student retention and academic performance strategies.
f8ab37b6-f990-42e6-a2dc-50421d1e79e9.name: Introduction to Learning Analytics

alignments.name: Teaching Excellence at Navitas Capability Framework
alignments.description: The TEN Capability Framework guides and supports teaching and academic support staff in the delivery of high-quality student learning experiences. This framework also offers a means to discuss, benchmark and provide evidence for performance, progress, and impact as appropriate across the diversity of learning and teaching contexts at Navitas.

alignments.name: TEQSA’s Higher Education Standards Framework (Threshold Standards) 2021
alignments.description: The Higher Education Standards Framework Threshold Standards sets the standards that a provider must meet and continue to meet to be registered to operate as a higher education provider in Australia. The Threshold Standards underpin and provide assurance of quality and integrity in the delivery of Australian higher education.

alignments.name: Advance HE Professional Standards Framework (PSF)
alignments.description: The Professional Standards Framework (PSF) is a globally recognised framework for benchmarking success within higher education teaching and learning.

badge_template_activities.title: Has successfully met the requirements and completed the Introduction to Learning Analytics module at Navitas.

5f344b1f-f8d7-4f12-9803-d9149fb1dd82.description: Earners of the ACAP MBA Marketing Strategy in a Digital World credential have a comprehensive understanding of how businesses can create and market value to ensure business success in today’s digital environment. Earners can communicate using fundamental methods and digital technologies, as a product-based solution that takes into account major trends occurring in the external environment and business capabilities.
5f344b1f-f8d7-4f12-9803-d9149fb1dd82.name: MKT4001 Marketing Strategy in a Digital World

alignments.name: Australian Qualifications Framework Level 8
alignments.description: AQF is the Australian Quality Framework. Level 8 refers to post graduate Certificate or Diploma level of study, and students at this level apply knowledge and skills to demonstrate autonomy, well-developed judgement, adaptability and responsibility as a practitioner or learner.

badge_template_activities.title: Participants have engaged in intensive learning sessions, participated in weekly learning activities, and engaged in robust discussions with peers and facilitators, as well as completed the following assessment tasks to demonstrate their understanding of Marketing Strategy in a Digital world.

Prepared a marketing issues report, identifying and evaluating the marketing strategy, marketing environment, and competitor analysis, substantiated with comprehensive SWOT & Porter’s 5-Forces. Based on the analysis, participants were also required to determine how these factors influence the business, industry, and the customer, and through this identify issues currently affecting the business.

Prepared a consultative marketing report as a group assignment, focussing on addressing the issues that were identified from findings in Assessment 1. In the marketing report, participants made recommendations to the business owners that will help them address those issues within the chosen marketplace.

Presented a group pitch to the chosen organisation proposing to implement suggested recommendations to address the potential issues identified in Assessment Task 1. The implementation plan is underpinned by practical application of the key concepts, principles and theory so that the firm can appraise its success.

8995090a-39a3-4030-9939-9c3161b8b4af.description: Earners of the Moderating and Validating Assessments module badge have demonstrated capability in facilitating student learning through judicious selection and use of assessment moderation and validation practices. Earners can evaluate the assessment moderation and validation practices and recommend improvements to the assessment methods in their teaching and learning context.
8995090a-39a3-4030-9939-9c3161b8b4af.name: Moderating and Validating Assessments.

badge_template_activities.title: Has successfully completed the assessment task and all requirements for the Moderating and Validating Assessments module within the Teaching Excellence at Navitas program.

79619546-0551-4445-9f26-b4c48487acf4.description: Earners of the Retention in the Navitas Context badge have defined retention as it applies to the Navitas context and described the key drivers of retention. They have identified teaching and support strategies to enhance the student learning experience and support students to achieve positive outcomes. Earners have also designed a teacher-led transition strategy to support learners navigate the transition to higher education.
79619546-0551-4445-9f26-b4c48487acf4.name: Retention in the Navitas Context
